title: Which guitar is better, the Ibanez RG350DXZ or the Ibanez Jem Jr.? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Ibanez RG450 series is on par with the Jem Jr. from my understanding. With Ibanez, higher numbers usually equals better, though there are exceptions and lemons at every level. Overall, I'd expect the Jem to be built just a little bit better, although the difference in quality isn't likely enough to justify the upcharge on the Jem unless the monkey grip and cosmetic differences are worth another $50-$100.

Besides cosmetic changes, they are almost the same guitar except that the RG350 has an Edge-Zero II tremolo that allegedly provide greater tuning stability and easier to adjust intonation. In addition, the RG350 is less expensive. Unless looks are important to you, save a few bucks and go for the RG350.
